knimeNode.name: Java Snippet
knimeNode.shortDescription: Calculates a new column based on java code snippets.

fullDescription.intro: This node allows you to execute arbitrary java code to create a new column or to replace an existing one. Enter the java code in the text area. To address certain input values of the table use $name_of_col$. For instance, the sum of the first two columns is $col_1$ + $col_2$ (replace col_1 and col_2 by the name of the columns). Please also specify the return type with one of the radio buttons. The final value will be the result of your last statement (after last ';'). Note, you can also use static methods of java utility classes, e.g. to get a column with random values, simply enter Math.random() and check the double return type.
fullDescription.option: Enter your java code here (the entire source will be wrapped in a method), do not add the return keyword though but only the statement that succeeds return. If you use more complex code, for instance loops, enter a (potentially unnecessary) ';' right before the return statement. You can add the name of a column by clicking its name in the left list. Note that numeric (double-compatible) columns will be handled as generic double, int-compatible columns as int and any other column type as String.
Specify here the resulting type of your code snippet. Unfortunately KNIME cannot determine what will be the correct return type - so you need to assist here.
Specify here if you want the result to be put into a separate or existing column.

ports.dataOut: Input table with an additional calculated column or one column replaced.
